utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: I'm not slacking.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Is that how you talk to your drill instructor?

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Sir, I'm not slacking.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: You stand up. You look me in the eye!

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: I feel lousy. I can't.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: "Can't" doesn't exist here! Now, you finish this course, or you're in isolation the rest of the day, you hear me? MacDonald, you ready to make Parks eat your dust?

utterance.speaker: MacDonald
utterance.content: Sir, yes, sir!

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Ready, go!

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: What's the matter, Parks? You got a boo boo?

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Sir, I'm bleeding, sir.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Is your life in immediate danger?

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Then you get your ass up over that wall! I said get your ass over that—aaah! Aah…

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: My back hurts. I can't move. Help. Help. I can't get up.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: "Can't" doesn't exist here.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Get—aaaaaah!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We should not be looking at this.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He sent out an alert. It would be rude not to look. Though I am straining my eyes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are we checking out?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why? I haven't— That… is not me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That is you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's me, but that is not. Whoever did this made it smaller. Much, much smaller.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whoever did this has a bone to pick with you. Ironic, since your bone is—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: is not in that picture. My proof is right here. You really want to see it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Oh, whoa. Convinced. You have any idea who did this?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't even know where the original picture is from.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The bathroom at the Carlton Hotel. The towel. Hotel logo's reversed. Shot must have been taken in the mirror.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We were there for Sanford Wells' wedding.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That must narrow it down.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He slept with three women there.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Oh, you're a whore!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 38-year-old former marine came into the E.R. with back pain. Now his bladder aches as much as his back because he can't empty it. What are we looking at this morning? Up-skirt celebrity? Endearingly funny cat?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Another study about gays being better parents. We were lured in by the word "lesbian." Has he taken any antihistamines or anticholinergics?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. And the E.R. ruled out enlarged prostate, stopped colon, and spinal injury.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Thanks. We can wean him off—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Steroids isn't fascinating, it's moronic. There's no other sign of hormonal imbalance. What's fascinating is that you equate discipline with bullying. Which means that your parents either disciplined you too much or too little — I'm guessing too little.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's hardly surprising you agree with our patient's philosophy. You run your department like a boot camp. As if cruelty ensures performance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, is this where I'm supposed to disagree with you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The diagnosis of urinary retention depends on the particular mechanical cause. We need to know if there's a blockage in the urethra versus a nerve or a muscle problem with the bladder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fascinating… without misdirect. Cath him and see what's stopping him from emptying his bilge. Oh, not you, Chase. Sending Captain Micropenis to deal with what is probably normal-sized equipment, it's too cruel, even for me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good morning. And what brings the lesser Cuddy to these parts?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Pediatrician appointment for an s-h-o-t. Waldenwood insists vaccination reports go in with the application. Honey, finish your oatmeal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Waldenwood. Is that by any chance a boarding school? Or a work camp?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's our first-choice preschool.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Blocks made of gold… Kids don't have to pick their own noses…

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Great facilities and teachers. And they're known for their gifted program.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You sure that's the right place for her? Sounds a little snobby.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I've done my research. We visited. It's a perfect fit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You'll feel pressure. I need you to tell us when the urge to void becomes unbearable.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sorry, can't make you feel better till we make you feel worse.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: I get it. Goes for what I do too.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We cause pain when it's the only option.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: The kids I work with at the camp are there because a judge sent them. I can't teach them good behaviors without first getting rid of all their bad ones. That's not gonna happen unless I push them.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I don't see why metaphorical pushing has to involve actual pushing.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: I may work these kids hard, but I never hit them.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it beats the alternatives, which is ending up in jail or in a gang or… a coffin.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How often do you pull that off?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Two-thirds never re-offend. That's better numbers than juvie.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's brilliant, but new to the real world.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey Doc, I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let's empty you out. Take this urine to Taub. Have him screen it for bacteria. I'll analyze this data.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Half hour on the phone, no go. Website won't take down the picture.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I thought their policy doesn't allow nude photos. Now tap the tube gently against the table to re-suspend the cells.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They don't. Technically… I'm no longer nude.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Maybe you should shut down your account.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I tried, but whoever did this changed my password, so I can't even prove it's my page.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, there's a clue. She's got serious text skills.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My password was "password."

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You're a dumb whore.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Do any of the three seem like a more likely suspect? Maybe one was clingier?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't even remember their names.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Listen, this is a tough time for me. Breaking up with Rachel, moving into a hotel. I want you to know how much your humiliation has eased my burden.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Urine is clean for bacteria.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not surprising, since his bladder tests show that his pain problem is really a nerve problem. Neurogenic bladder.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Could mean spinal cord tumor, cerebral palsy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House is gonna go right for syphilis.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: How can he be so sure?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Rare complication of an embarrassing illness. It's practically a House special.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I want to get ahead. Let's go test his blood for syphilis.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Okay, I'm gonna take some blood. This will only hurt for a second. Ready?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Stop it! Stop trying to kill me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, let her go.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: That girl was trying to kill me!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let her go. Security, get some help in here!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's fine. How 'bout we get back to someone who isn't?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Differential diagnosis. Back pain, neurogenic bladder, psychosis.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: A symptom which we learned about when he choked me. Hate to slow us down by acknowledging it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And yet you have. Tertiary syphilis fits.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The tests came back negative. Several meds could cause those symptoms. Tricyclic antidepressants, ritalin.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Also other native plants. Wormwood, jimson weed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The amount of jimson weed or ritalin he'd have to ingest, seems like he would have mentioned it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Unless he didn't know about it. Maybe one of those kids at the camp got tired of Driscoll's lessons and poisoned him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go to the camp. Check for potential poisons.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I all but ignored your assault, showed you no compassion whatsoever, but you came up with a good idea. Score one for tough love.

utterance.speaker: Wells
utterance.content: Glad to hear you met someone you like. Weddings are good for that.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was hoping to get in touch. The thing is, I'm a bit fuzzy on names. Sorry. Open bar. She was sitting at Dr. Simpson's table. Brunette, purple dress, low-cut.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your niece? Fantastic!

utterance.speaker: Wells
utterance.content: Her info is in your email.

utterance.speaker: Wells
utterance.content: You want me to hook you up with two women?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Actually, three.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How do you cheat on a test when there's no test?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sorry, not playing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Go away, House. I am not giving you advice just so you can distort it to suit your own warped world view.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But it's been working so well. Cuddy wants to get Rachel into Waldenwood preschool. The problem is, Rachel's dumber than a paste sandwich.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And her not getting in bothers you. You care about Rachel. That was not advice.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cuddy cares about her. When Rachel gets rejected, Cuddy will be upset. And as the boyfriend, I will be expected to be supportive and consoling.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Not your strengths, I grant you. Leave it alone. It's just a play date. It'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Play date being their code for way to weed out the paste sandwiches. They'll hand her puzzles and counting games, and Rachel will just sit there and eat the pieces.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, crap! Crap! I'm such a sucker!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That's the isolation area. Kids who've behaved badly go there, sometimes 23 hours a day.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sound like a pretty good incentive to behave.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yeah, by treating the symptom instead of the disease. Basic systems theory. Troubled kids are produced by troubled families. This place doesn't even attempt to change the environment that damaged them in the first place.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So there are no bad kids, only bad parents? Then why is my brother an ex-con?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Treating kids decently doesn't mean identically. Some kids need more structure or discipline. Nobody needs this place.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe we're coming at this wrong. We find a poisoner, and let them point us toward the poison.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Driscoll's got 24 kids in his troop. You want to interview all of them?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe we don't need to.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Driscoll sent me to isolation all the time. It doesn't mean I poisoned him. He's the psycho, not me. Tell 'em.

utterance.speaker: MacDonald
utterance.content: D.I. Driscoll's way harder on him than the rest of us.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Maybe because he's a bigger pain in the ass. What are you in here for?

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Shoplifting.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You ready to upgrade to second-degree murder? Spend ten years in jail? If he dies because of whatever you gave him, that's what'll happen.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: That supposed to scare me? My mom's dead, my dad's never been around. And after this, I'll get bounced to another foster home. My future's not exactly bright. Prison now or later doesn't make that much of a difference to me.

utterance.speaker: MacDonald
utterance.content: Dude, I'm not mopping the whole floor by myself.

utterance.speaker: MacDonald
utterance.content: It's just my allergies.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Do you take anything for them?

utterance.speaker: MacDonald
utterance.content: Not right now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: These IV fluids will help flush the drugs out of your system.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: You know which of the kids dosed me?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's not medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Look, I'm not gonna hurt him. But I get why you're scared of me. I'm real sorry about this morning.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No apology necessary. You're ill. You didn't know what you were doing.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: I used to be a real screw-up. The military taught me that actions always have consequences. Part of being a man is accepting them. And after all the times I've said that to the kids, an apology is necessary.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: My heart's kinda racing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I got it. Heart rate is 170. P.A.T. until proven otherwise, we've gotta slow it down. Six milligrams adenosine, IV bolus. Tell the nurse to get in here with the crash cart.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pushing fluid sent his heart into overdrive. It took three doses of adenosine to get it under control.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House, where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Playground. Great place to meet chicks. Their moms too.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tachycardia could be a humoral effect — mastocytosis.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We'd see other GI or cutaneous symptoms. Pancreatic insulinoma.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It would cause bladder problems, unlike pheochromocytoma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well done, Chase. Now, turn off your phone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You heard that? It's on vibrate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, no, no, you're right. This is in no way clever and hysterical.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Before you start rolling anyone in flour, work the patient out for a pheo. Adrenaline pituitary scans, 24-hour urine collection.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: How soon after the admissions session did the child get sick?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The kid barely got home before she collapsed. Her parents are a wreck. Desperate for answers. Have you experienced any symptoms, or does someone else oversee these sessions?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: The teachers supervise. No one's mentioned feeling sick. I'd love to call the family and offer my support.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, I can't reveal names. Doctor-patient confidentiality. So this is where all the admissions play dates happen? She wouldn't have been in another room?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: This is where we have them all. Maybe, to be safe, we get rid of these toys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, no, no, don't do that. I'll tell you if anything's toxic. For now, you should minimize your exposure.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm supposed to be supervised.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The scan is pre-programmed. There's no risk to the patient. You're literally gonna sit here, watch the monitor, and chat with him if he gets lonely.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh… still.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Report me.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: How you doing in there?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: You shouldn't bother trying to protect Landon. I know he's the one who drugged me.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The antihistamines aren't what got you sick.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Doesn't change the fact that he did it. I tried everything with that kid. I just… can't break through.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's clear you care about him. Have you tried telling him that?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: You gotta understand something. These kids, they're all manipulators. As much as I care about all of them, I can't—I can't show them that unless there's some mutual respect. Otherwise…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Forget those other kids. Think about this kid. He watched his mother get sick and die. He's never known his dad. Who knows how long it's been since anyone's taken care of him, or if there's ever been a man around with any degree of consistency? I believe that you're on his side. I'm betting it would help if he did.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You are a beautiful man. Can I leave now?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know where all three women are, but I'd like to avoid the additional humiliation of falsely accusing any of them. You I.D.’d the hotel off this. I'm hoping there's another clue in there somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We could enhance the image. Maybe her face is reflected in that gleam off your butt cheek. Or maybe it's time to chalk this up to the hazards of being a player.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your zipper problems just blew up your marriage.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Don't move. Unlike me, you've had the decency not to cheat on anyone, but you haven't been giving much thought to who these women are, how they might feel. Obviously, you hurt one of them. Emotionally, you hurt her, because physically, how would you even know?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Looks like your shorty is a shorty.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're early. Dinner's not ready.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm hungry. Go cook.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All right, you little lump of clay…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rachel. Rachel… It's a new toy. What kid doesn't like new toys? A moron, that's who. Okay, look at the pretty colors. Now, what color is this? Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Orange!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, that is orange. What color is this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, blocks going away.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bye-bye blocks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Next time, reinforce the levees. Bad Corps of Army Engineers. Bad! What's this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh! Rings! Look at the rings. Now, the goal of this game is…

utterance.speaker: Winn
utterance.content: Why are you here? Wait, did you give me an STD?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, I did not. Don't deflect. That picture was taken by someone your height. Just take it down.

utterance.speaker: Winn
utterance.content: What picture?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fine. Play it that way. So, uh… you really like kittens, huh?

utterance.speaker: Winn
utterance.content: Yeah. You said you did too. No wonder you're pissed. 'Cause that is not you. And I didn't take it. Did you mean my height with heels or without?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You weren't wearing heels when we were in that room— Oh, yes, you were.

utterance.speaker: Winn
utterance.content: I started to take them off, and then you asked me very nicely not to. Why would I do this? I mean, I'm not mad about what happened with us. Or apparently with you and any other woman at that wedding.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sorry, I guess my forensic analysis wasn't as advanced as I thought.

utterance.speaker: Winn
utterance.content: Wait. You know, you don't have to rush off. I still have those heels…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Everywhere you looked, gingham and stuffed animals.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How did you get out of there?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I didn't… right away. Wasn't anything wrong with her physically.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: One down, two members of the threesome to go. You should flip a condom to choose.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We checked his adrenal, pituitary, and thyroid glands. Monitored his catecholamines. It's not a pheo.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We had to put him on a diltiazem drip to regulate his heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That means he's running out of time. It means you are too. Your campaign to soften him up so he would go easier on the kids… All in a pointless attempt to validate your own upbringing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Another cardiac arrhythmia?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Not our patient. It's the ER.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: That patient House admitted with back pain and urinary retention… How do you feel about a matched set?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need to track your common exposures. What shampoo do you use?

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Whatever crap the camp gives us.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Same here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need things exclusive to you, but not the rest of the camp. Otherwise, a lot more people would be sick. Toothpaste, deodorant.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Can't be deodorant making him sick. He doesn't wear any.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Park, shut your mouth.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Doesn't mean you get to be disrespectful.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: I can do whatever the hell I want. You're not in charge.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There's gotta be a link. Diet, sexual history, drug abuse.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. Believe me, I asked. Those were some fun conversations.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you believe the answers?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know the answer to that is always supposed to be no, but I did. Not like the kid has had much unsupervised time lately.

utterance.speaker: Florist
utterance.content: Delivery for Dr. Robert Chase.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's me.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The camp is in the woods. There are tons of opportunities for infection that not every person will pick up. Legionellosis from water, toxoplasmosis from dirt, brucellosis from animals.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Too bad none of those explain his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Casey and Sanford Wells thank me for my extraordinarily generous donation to their wedding charity.”

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Aww.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh, God. She must have gotten access to my credit card.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nocardia fits. Bacteria lives in the dirt. They both—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nocardia starts in the lungs, not the bladder.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How generous is extraordinarily generous?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Call the charity. Explain the donation's a fraud.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And take back Wells' wedding gift? You are extraordinarily screwed. Bushes can make a happy hunting ground for ticks, Lyme disease.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Neither of our patients have a rash or tick bite.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 40% of Lyme patients don't develop a rash, and a bite is easy to miss.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start him on doxycycline for lyme.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cancel your credit card, find that girl, and marry her.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Go back. That was Jersey Shore.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: I'm not watching that crap.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: No, let him be your Guinea pig. You can dose me after you're sure you're right.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The side effects are fairly limited. And it would be better to treat you before you develop any more symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: I want to wait.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Is there anything else I can do for you?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Hey. Your turn to pick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ready, set, feed the monkey!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, this isn't weird at all.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's got the fine motor skills of The Hulk in oven mitts. Do you want a doodle? Do you? Feed the monkey. Cuddy puts her to bed at 7:30, which cuts way into our training time. Play date's on Friday.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dog training clicker. Gives immediate positive reinforcement, bridging the precious seconds between desired behavior and treat delivery.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, she's not a dog. It really seems to be working. Does Cuddy know that Rachel's here, and that you're turning her into a schnauzer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I told Marina that Rachel and I are working on a secret art project for mommy. Which means that some Peds patient is about to be short one art project.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The sacrifices we make for our children's education.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's a good girl? Who's a good girl?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It had to be you. I gave you my credit card to pay for drinks.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: And I gave it back. I didn't take the picture. Now go away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, forgive me if I'm not convinced. You're obviously pissed at me.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Because I thought we totally had a connection. And then when you didn't ask me for my number, I—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A connection? It was a threesome!

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Yeah, but you were obviously more into me than you were into Nika.

utterance.speaker: Man voice coming from inside the house
utterance.content: Kenzie, honey, you have a phone call.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Just a minute, dad. I didn't want to say anything in front of her, but you could have.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Just until graduation.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: 18… next month. Relax, it's not illegal or anything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Look, I just need this to stop.

utterance.speaker: Mackenzie
utterance.content: Would you give it up already? I told you, it's not me. My parents won't even let me on social networking sites. Too many sexual predators.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Stop him!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, hey. Where you going? Hey, you're sick. You need to be in the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: There's a million hospitals. Ones that won't send me back to that camp!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Landon, what's going on?

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Please, help me. Don't send me back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No bad kids, huh?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Did you stop Landon?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Oh, my legs, they hurt. The muscles are in a vise.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What does it mean?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not sure yet. Ten Diazepam. 40 potassium.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The leg pain was caused by a muscle cramp from low sodium, which was caused by kidney dysfunction.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Landon didn't respond to doxycycline either. I think we can rule out Lyme. I thought I was getting through to him, and he just wanted to steal my car keys.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If only his previous behavior had given you a reason to expect that.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why are you putting hot sauce on a toy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe you don't care if children chew on your caterpillar. I think it's wrong. What causes kidney dysfunction on top of everything else?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Arsenic poisoning. And people do change. Driscoll took it to heart when I asked him to think about Landon's history. He was much nicer, and then—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow, two ideas that don't make any sense. If it was arsenic, they'd be puking and pooping. And conversations with moralizing strangers do not make people change their behavior.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Rachel is not gonna do that more than once!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Whipple's could affect the brain, kidneys, heart.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Not without G.I. involvement. Why is it impossible to believe I made a compelling argument, and he—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If he changed, it's because something besides you made that argument compelling.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Compromised kidneys secondary to bladder issues points to botulism toxin, which lives in soil. Got into the kid's bloodstream through the cut on his forehead. Got into the drill instructor’s through some abrasions on his feet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good idea. Give 'em both the antitoxin.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: I saw my chance to get out of here. I had to take it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Don't make excuses. You tried to steal from me.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Oh, these kids are manipulators. You can't let your guard down.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: What do you mean "all these kids"? Don't lump me in with the losers at that camp.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Seems like you belong there. It may be your only chance.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Look, I've screwed up, but I've never been in trouble with the law.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Store owner caught me trying to boost some chips and stuff. Called my DCS caseworker.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I thought all the kids were there under court order.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: That's usually how it works.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So why is he different?

utterance.speaker: Nika
utterance.content: Why would I take a naked picture of you? You're cute, but you're not that cute. Now please go.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're the only one left. You're pissed off.

utterance.speaker: Nika
utterance.content: I'm pissed off because you're in my apartment, and my boyfriend might be here any minute.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Nika
utterance.content: Last thing I want to do is publicize that I cheated on him, so why would I prank you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And where was this boyfriend at the wedding?

utterance.speaker: Nika
utterance.content: Out of town.

utterance.speaker: Nika
utterance.content: It's from my sister's birthday last month. And before you suggest he's my brother, note how I'm kissing him. You used me, I used you. It was a mistake. Now I just want to forget about it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I just got off the phone with Landon's DCS caseworker. You were right. I'm not what made my argument compelling.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: To give your bladder an antibiotic wash to protect against infection.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm Dr. House. And that boy is the spitting image of his mother. Of course, I've never seen her, but his care worker told my lackey that you paid his enrollment fee at the camp. That could mean that you're a family friend, but then, why hide it? The only person who'd want to hide it… is his deadbeat dad, who has decided not to be a deadbeat anymore.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Please, don't tell him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We spend days looking for a link between them, and he doesn't tell us the kid is his son.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We were looking for exposures. He didn't think it was medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Soon, he won't have to worry about his kid finding out. Being dead makes keeping secrets much easier. Neither one was responding to botulism treatment, and the boy started having seizures.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And Driscoll might have been right that their biological relationship doesn't matter. Genetic illness emerges when people are the same age, not during the same week.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Unless there's a trigger. Genetic conditions can be set off by things in the surroundings, and these two obviously share surroundings.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That's a relatively rare phenomenon. Which is our specialty, I know.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Our patients are related. That can't be a coincidence. I just had an idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Relevant to our case?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wegener's can be brought on by exposure to heavy metals. Did you see anything at the camp?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Near the isolation hut, there were some old generator batteries. Could have leaked into the soil?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Seems like someone else in the camp would have had lead poisoning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got anything better? Treat with cyclophosphamide. Go find your bliss. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a play date.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: I found out she'd passed months later. By then, Landon was already in the foster system. I was figuring out a way to approach him when he got into trouble, so I-I brought him to the camp.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You need to tell him.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: I can't. Not now. If I die, the only thing I'll ever be to him is the hardass who made him run obstacle courses.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You'll apologize to me for something done in a psychotic state, but you won't own up to being his father. What happened to "actions have consequences, a man accepts them"?

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: I'm in his life, and I am working to get him on the right path.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He doesn't need a drill instructor. He needs a dad.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's so sweet of you coming to this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just trying to be supportive. I've heard that's what boyfriends do.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hi, honey. Hi. Did you have fun? Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Rachel had a great time. Played with everything. She's a very clever girl. I'm sorry to ask this, but we've had some problems with parents coaching kids. Rachel caught onto our toys unusually quickly, and she even knew the game was called "Feed the Monkey."

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, mama.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: You're pumped 'cause your kid lied?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not my kid. She's a pain in the ass. And she's a better liar than you are. You didn't cut your leg getting into your truck. The abrasion has dirt and gravel in it. A bit of fertilizer too.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Tripped in my greenhouse. Growing my own organic veggies.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't ask. Not gonna tell. She didn't hesitate. She didn't oversell. Took me years to learn how to lie like that. And Rachel has it on instinct.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Sounds like you're real fond of that kid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're really not good with nuance, are you? I admire her talent. I'm just gonna numb you up… I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Latest kidney function test shows no improvement.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice stitches. Do they hurt?

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: No. They gave me a shot of something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was Lidocaine. It triggered an underlying genetic condition called variegate porphyria.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That would explain their symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: But I didn't have any Lidocaine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you had a handful of antihistamines, courtesy of the deviant in the next bed. It's also a porphyria trigger.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Wait, so we have the same genetic thing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah… small world.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: This is good news. We can manage the condition with hematin. A liver transplant could cure it.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Sometimes two patients share one donated liver. Would that work for us?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Possibly. We'd have to test your blood, tissue type. And if they matched—

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Why would they? Just because we have the same thing making us sick…

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Also… I'm your father.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't think a white guy can be a bad father? Happy to check your DNA. Do you really think he'd say he's your dad if he isn't? It's not like you're a catch.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're evil.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You were at the wedding with your sister.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: Shared a room with her too. I came by to change my shoes, and… I found you in the bathroom. It took you long enough to find me.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: This has nothing to do with my sister.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then what does it have to do with?

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: If you really have no clue, then you so deserve this.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: All that creativity and energy you put into pranking me… It seems like you were trying to make a point. You really don't want to tell me what it was?

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: You're a really big fan of John Hughes movies. You inexplicably prefer Some Kind of Wonderful to Sixteen Candles, though that's probably because…

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: It was great… until I mentioned that I don't sleep with guys on the first date. And then you said you had to go to the bathroom, and you never came back. Actions have consequences.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Do you seek vengeance on every guy who acts like an ass? Could be a full-time job.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hey, I'm-I'm sorry. Let me prove it to you by taking you out to dinner. Followed by not sleeping with you. I'm serious.

utterance.speaker: Ali
utterance.content: Not on your life.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Landon
utterance.content: Nothin' to say.

utterance.speaker: Driscoll
utterance.content: Okay. I'll wait till you're ready. You're my son. I'm not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Wait a minute. What is that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: A doggy!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What does it say?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ruff!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's right.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Waldenwood called. They love Rachel, but they have no room. Something about more siblings than usual. We should apply next year.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You mean that?
